fields.description:
If a user evaluates Confluence under an Evaluation licence, they see the following banner as a footer on their Confluence pages:

"EVALUATION LICENSE  — Are you enjoying Confluence? Please consider purchasing it today."

The words "purchasing it" are hyperlinked to the lead the user to a page where he/she can start the process of purchasing the product. However, this link is erroneous, leading to something like:

http://www.atlassian.comhttp//www.atlassian.com/c/12520/buy-new

The above link should be:

http://www.atlassian.com/c/12520/buy-new
fields.summary: The "purchasing it" link at the footer of a Confluence page (under an Evaluation Licence) is incorrect.

fields.description:
I created a stand-alone Java application that connects to Confluence and calls the method getActiveUsers (String[] users = service.getActiveUsers(authToken, true) which retrieves all Confluence users.

Java application code is :
String authToken = service.login(user, password);
// USERS and GROUPS
String[] users = service.getActiveUsers(authToken, true);
PRINT_STREAM.println("Succesfully called getActiveUsers");

1/ When Confluence has local Confluence users, stand-alone Java application retrieves all Confluence users.

2/ When Confluence has an LDAP configuration (GCAatlassian-user.xml in attachment), the server returns a 500 Internal Server Error when this method is called. Just for information, I can log on Confluence with an LDAP user.

The SOAP package (save with wireshark) looks like the following:
HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"><soapenv:Body><soapenv:Fault><faultcode>soapenv:Server.userException</faultcode><faultstring>java.lang.NullPointerException</faultstring><detail><faultData xsi:type="ns1:NullPointerException" xmlns:ns1="http://lang.java"/><ns2:hostname xmlns:ns2="http://xml.apache.org/axis/">srv-websphere1-was2</ns2:hostname></detail></soapenv:Fault></soapenv:Body></soapenv:Envelope>

We have configured confluence\WEB-INF\classes\log4j.properties of Confluence and the following server error is raised (in attachment GCAatlassian-confluence.log file). The main message error which I don't understand is 'userName: anonymous'. In our stand-alone Java application, I used the authentication token when I call service.getActiveUsers(authToken, true). The user is a authorized user because when I call service.getSpaces(authToken);, no error is raised.


3/ We have made these tests on two different Confluence servers (the first which runs on WebSphere application server, the second which runs on TomCat application server).

Does a Confluence configuration is mandatory to get Confluence LDAP users with RFC function?
fields.summary: getActiveUsers : LDAP Confluence configuration : 500 Internal Server Error

fields.description:
Hello,

The mail.jar distributed with JavaMail API 1.4 does not contain sun.mail.pop3.POP3Message that is referenced in Confluence 2.10 source. At my company we use internal Maven proxy when compiling Confluence, which uses Atlassian Maven repository as a remote backend, but it also contains some 3rd party stuff such as the JavaMail API so no local deployment is necessary. We have version 1.4.1 of the javax.mail.mail installed. In confluence-2.10-source/confluence-project/confluence/pom.xml the following dependency is defined:

        <dependency>
            <groupId>javax.mail</groupId>
            <artifactId>mail</artifactId>
        </dependency>

Since no version is specified, Maven picks up the latest version of the artifact in can find, and in this case it's 1.4.1. Since there's no sun.mail.pop3.POP3Message class in the jar, Confluence compilation will fail. I patched the pom.xml like this:

        <dependency>
            <groupId>javax.mail</groupId>
            <artifactId>mail</artifactId>
            <version>1.3.3</version>
        </dependency>

And now it picks up the version 1.3.3 which is also installed on our local repository and this version contains POP3Message class. Now Confluence is built successfully. I think it would be great if Confluence was shipped with a pom.xml that refers to known working version of the 1.3.x series of Java MailApi by default. http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Building+Confluence+From+Source+Code would need updating, though, instead of referring to version 1.x.x you should use the exactly same version there as what's defined in the POM.
fields.summary: Please add versioned dependency to javax.mail

fields.description:
*Symptoms*

The problem appears to be that a plugin is somehow disabled after a Confluence instance is restarted. If you look through the logs you'll find something like:

{code}
WARN ... [com.atlassian.plugin.DefaultPluginManager] isPluginEnabled Plugin com.atlassian.confluence.extra.widgetconnector is out of sync with the plugin system, disabling
{code}

If you look at the access logs for the same time, you should find that someone was administering that plugin either via the Plugins or Plugin Repository admin areas. 

You might also see messages in the main log of the form:

{code}
ERROR ... [atlassian.renderer.v2.V2Renderer] render Unable to render content due to system error: Cannot retrieve plugin module before it is enabled: PluginModuleHolder[com.atlassian.confluence.extra.widgetconnector.WidgetMacro@3c6957]
{code}

when users make subsequent calls to pages that use the plugin. Note that the plugin might still appear enabled after the time of the first log message, but it will be disabled after a Confluence restart.


*Cause*

There is a known issue with the Atlassian Plugin framework ([PLUG-222|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PLUG-222]) where, if a plugin's "enabled" state is queried in one thread while it is being changed in another (due to an upgrade, uninstall/reinstall or disable/enable) the plugin's state will be set to "disabled". However, this state may not be getting checked until Confluence is restarted because a subclass of DefaultPluginManager, ConfluencePluginManager, stores the enabled state separately.

Plugin state can be checked very frequently, depending on the cache, so the problem can be caused by almost any usage of Confluence during the small window of plugin state change (typically less than a second).
 
The fix for the problem will involve a change to the Plugin framework code to "lock" the plugin's state while it is being administered, and most likely a reworking of the ConfluencePluginManager code to better synchronize the state.


*Workaround*

The problem arises because the plugin is being accessed while it's being altered and will not occur during everyday usage. To re-enable an incorrectly-disabled plugin, simply enable the plugin when no-one is using Confluence, and check the logs to confirm that the above warning message doesn't re-appear.
fields.summary: Plugin being disabled after being upgraded or re-enabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13898].
  {panel}

Hi,

Currently, if you granted a user with the 'remove page permission' then he is able to remove all the pages of the concerned space.

I would like to tighten the scope of this permission and to be allowed to grant a user with the 'remove page permission' but only if he is the creator of the page.

Thanks and regards,
Stephane
fields.summary: Space admin / tighten permission

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a news page
# Insert a line that ends with _italic_ content. For instance:
{noformat}Test _content_{noformat}
# Save the page
# The resultant page:
!calendar.jpg|thumbnail!

This problem happens only in IE7. The following browsers have been tested, but to no avail:

* Firefox 3.0.4
* IE6
* Opera 9.27
* Safari 3.1.2
* IE8 Beta 2
fields.summary: Calendar and date navigation in IE7 not completely visible when current blog content ends with italic
Recently-updated-dashboard macro should accept 'type' as well as 'types' as a parameter

fields.description:
Affects both {recently-updated} and {recently-updated-dashboard} macros.

When the macro is showing recently updated content for a single user, then:

If showProfilePic=false, each item will be shown with the time and date it was updated.

If showProfilePic=true, then only the time and date of the most recently updated item will be shown. This will then imply that all content shown was updated at that time, even though the actual changes may have been made days or weeks before.  See screenshot for an illustration of this.
fields.summary: Recently-updated macros show all content under the same time and date when showProfilePic=true

fields.description:
The wysiwyg editor we use (TinyMCE) supports context menus. 
We should be able to configure this for:
* table editing
* insert image
* insert link
fields.summary: Add context menus for the RTE
Plugin state conflict when plugin installed at same time as plugin state is checked.

fields.description:
When selecting text and changing from Paragraph to Quote style, the following paragraphs will continue to use Quote style even though Paragraph is selected.

See attached.
fields.summary: Using Quote style in RTE is buggy

fields.description:
# Navigate to a page containing attachments
# Click to view the Browse menu
# Hover the cursor over any menu item

A tooltip will appear showing the number of attachments on the page.

This should not happen. It did not happen in 2.9.2, and could be irritating for the user.
fields.summary: Tooltip showing number of attachments is showing for all items in the Browse menu

fields.description:
When people edit a page using the Rich Text Editor, confluence  removes escape character (slash) in front of a minus sign in brackets like this:
\(-)

See *page history* for the Confluence 2.10 release notes, where Sarah had to repeatedly restore the escape character after other people had edited the page using the Rich Text Editor.
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+2.10+Release+Notes
http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpreviousversions.action?pageId=168003443
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor removes escape character (slash) in front of brackets
ContentbyLabel doesn't support news from personal spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13886].
  {panel}

The following documents are piecemeal and sporadic:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/External+Database
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Configuration
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+Guides
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrate+to+Another+Database

These four resources should be combined and streamlined. Remember to consider that installation and upgrade guides refer to this documentation.

Drafts in progress:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/DRAFTdb+-+Migrating+to+Another+Database -- *first draft complete*
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/DRAFTdb+-+Database+Setup+For+MySQL  -- *first draft complete*
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/DRAFTdb+-+Database+Setup+for+Oracle -- *first draft complete*
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/DRAFTdb+-+Database+Setup+for+SQL+Server -- *first draft complete*
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/DRAFTdb+-+Configuring+a+SQL+Server+Datasource+in+Apache+Tomcat -- *first draft complete*
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/DRAFTdb+-+Database+Setup+for+PostgreSQL -- *first draft complete*
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/DRAFTdb+-+Configuring+a+PostgreSQL+Datasource+in+Apache+Tomcat -- *first draft complete*

New page in progress:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+an+Oracle+Datasource+in+Apache+Tomcat -- -- *first draft complete*

Reviews:
* I've asked David Mason to review the two Oracle docs. _Friday 26 April:_ He's happy with the docs. Suggested I combine the notes about needing to be a DBA.
* Held a meeting with Renan and David M on Wednesday 1 May for final review of the entire set. Just a few changes to make, now also applied.

Ready to publish!

Similar to: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-13671

# Browser Space

For example; \{include:Space Description}

fields.description:
Check a gallery with large images: 
http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~wkoysiripong/2008/11/28/Chris+Owen%27s+Farewell+Photos

It seems that the gallery first preloads the image (it takes a 18seconds before the lightbox is opened), and then it progressively renders the image, which again takes 18s!

Loading the second image seems to work fine though, it immediately goes into the progressive rendering mode.

fields.description:
A customer (https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-24847) found that Confluence Daily notification is consuming up to 100% of the CPU (1 of 4 CPUs) performance. This performance issue would run up to several hours, causing slow overall Confluence performance. 

His instance is quite large and has over 5000 updates everyday.

Using [Matt Ryall's script|^blast-pages.py], I was able to imitate this behaviour in a local instance and noticed a 100% CPU spike (1 of 8 CPUs) - it goes up and down but on average it's between 80% - 90%. 

I created 6000 pages in a single space using the script and set one user to receive the daily update which was sent to a local mail server.

fields.description:
To reproduce:
1. Get a site export from an instance where filesystem attachment storage is configured
2. Import this export into a clustered instance
3. Check the Attachment Storage screen from the admin console. It will display filesystem when you can only store attachments in the database for a cluster. Even though filesystem is displayed, it is still using the database under the hood. 

To fix this problem, we will need to ignore the attachment storage setting in global settings imported (for a site import) for clustered instances.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13864].
  {panel}

There's a few places where we can indicate read-only transactions to the Spring transaction wrappers. This removes the need for Hibernate to do a dirty check as part of it's "flush-if-necessary" check at the end of the transaction interceptor and improves performance.

Specifically, the following should be read-only:

- DAO transaction interceptor, get* methods
- PermissionManager interceptor, has* methods
- Plugin transaction interceptor, get* methods.

Additionally, get* methods on UserAccessor can be read-only except for ones that access property sets.
fields.summary: Improve performance by configuring read-only transactions on more Spring proxies

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13855].
  {panel}

1. Develop a monitoring framework within Confluence
a) specify concrete action triggers (by default)
b) allow users to tune these triggers according to their needs
eg. recognise import version of XML and ban it with an error, preventing imports from *not* the same major version to fail
eg. memory trigger - when reaching more than 90% of memory usage for more than 20 sec (as one would expect sudden spikes in memory usage, yet not necessary long lasting ones)
eg. usage patterns
eg. broken/outdated macros
eg. cache is not tunes

2. Specify Admin group to be notified on events
Upon any of the above triggers, confluence will send a blog to the pre-defined group of people and also can produce a report in an Admin > Reports section

3. Option to integrate with internal 'Log Analysis' tool
Fetch new error file description from ATL server and run analysis tool to provide report when pre-configured trigger occurs.

4. Hooking up into 'Create Support Request' feature

There is a plethora of events which the application can be _made_ to monitor. I'd suggest to first create the reporting framework (as the blogging framework already exists) and implement one or two items from the list. We can keep adding to it in the future.
fields.summary: Confluence blogging when problem is to occur

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13854].
  {panel}

It would be marvelous to have an option in the admin section to be able to configure and tune indexing of content and attachments within confluence.

||type||size||condition||
|pdf|3|skip passwd protected|
|doc|1|avoid follow internal URL|
|ppt|2|not video stream|

We can ship pre-configured defaults and prevent the application to slave away on indexing massive 10 or 20 Mgb pdf or ppt documents when it is not really necessary. Thus alleviating potential performance and problems with searches.
fields.summary: Tune indexing

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13849].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 28 January 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hello everyone,

We are pleased to announce that we have released support for OpenID Connect for our Data Center products.

You can learn more about it here: [https://www.atlassian.com/blog/enterprise/openid-connect]


Please note that in order to use OpenID Connect you will need Data Center license.

You can create your evaluation license for your Data Center product here [https://my.atlassian.com/license/evaluation]

We hope that you will enjoy it!

Please reply directly to my email to share your feedback or just add your comments in this ticket. We'd love to hear your thoughts!

Best regards,

Marek Radochonski
 Senior Product Manager
 [mradochonski@atlassian.com|mailto:mradochonski@atlassian.com]
{panel}


OpenID is a great way to avoid forcing people to remember yet another login/password and means we wouldn't have to worry about people forgetting their passwords etc. More and more sites are using it and a lot of people already have one via another service (eg Yahoo!, Flickr, etc.)

There is a bogpost about confluence support of OpenID here: http://blogs.atlassian.com/developer/2007/02/_with_the_recent_press.html

OpenID support would be great for confluence instance that allow registration/login of public users. This support should also be integrated with confluence instances that delegate logins to crowd.
fields.summary: Consider using OpenID for Confluence signon

fields.description:
Confluence is used to store a lot of types of documentation, including project specific information for current and historic projects, product information, discussions, etc. 
It would be ideal if the quick search would perform a global search but ignore some spaces that contain historic project information and/or discussions, as most often people need to find the latest information from product specific space or the most current project.
If this is implemented than there should probably be an option to perform global search including the filtered out spaces.

This would help to control the number of hits a search returns and show the most relevant entries.
fields.summary: CLONE - Exclude a space from a global search

fields.description:
If a user uses wild card or range queries such as "content-name-untokenized:{A to Z}" or "content-name-untokenized:S*" then the default behaviour of the {{QueryParser}} classes used in both {{TextFieldQueryMapper}} and {{MultiTextFieldQueryMapper}} is to lower case any range or wild card expansions.

So should the user be searching a field which is not converted to lower case such as the one given above then they will have no way of finding the upper case values - the QueryParser makes all their queries lower case.

The place this affects us in Confluence is in the {{AlphabeticalListPagesAction}} which when you choose to see all pages starting with a particular letter builds a wildcard query such as those shown above.
fields.summary: Wildcard and range queries always converted to lower case

fields.description: Many plugins use Velocity template that are not structured to work correctly with Confluence's "Anti-XSS" feature. fields.summary: Recently-Updated macro throws a BooleanQuery$TooManyClauses exception

fields.description:
I've just discovered from Andrew Lynch (i.e. as his punishment for not recording this anywhere you should try to make him write the documentation!) that while Confluence 2.10 will no longer support MySQL4.1 it should still work if the system property {{mysql4Compability}} is set.

So I guess there are perhaps three tasks required here -
# Ensure that the [supported databases|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/%28hidden+draft%29+List+Of+Supported+Databases] page notes this
# Ensure that [Database setup for MySQL|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+For+MySQL] notes this
# Ensure this information is linked or recorded in the release note.
fields.summary: MySQL 4 no longer supported but should work if a particular system property is set

fields.description: Postgresql uses bytea data type to store attachments in the database, when attachments are too large the postgresql fails with OOM errors as the entire attachment is held in memory.
fields.summary: Storing/Retrieving large attachments from Postgresql database results in OOM Error

fields.description: When I select *Installed Plugins* from the dropdown that says *All Plugins* by default, I see many plugins that are not installed. This is indicated by the *Install* link in the install column.
fields.summary: Plugin Repository's "Installed Plugins" filter shows non-installed plugins

fields.description:
When you edit a page with columns that have pixel widths (not just % widths), the rich text editor shows the columns which is nice, but as soon as you save it - the page loses the pixel width on any columns that have pixel width.

The attached screen shots show this.  :-)
fields.summary: Editing page with columns in 2.10 - the columns lose the pixel wide screwing up the page.

fields.description:
1. Add new user with user name that contains special characters e.g. <script>alert('free')</script>
2. User created
3. Login as new user and create personal space
4. Personal space created but links to it result in page not found error

For this example the link provided is encoded as;
http://localhost:8080/confluence/display/~%253Cscript%253Ealert%2528%2527free%2527%2529%253C%252Fscript%253E
fields.summary: user names can contain characters that prevent that user from accessing their own personal space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13833].
  {panel}

We can greatly decrease the number of requests by using image sprites.

See http://www.alistapart.com/articles/sprites/
http://paulstamatiou.com/2007/07/25/how-to-optimize-your-site-with-image-sprites

This would be great for our menu icons, page/blogpost/attachment icons (quicknav & search) and other commonly used images in Confluence.
fields.summary: Improve load times through use of image sprites

fields.description:
1. Enter invalid label in either content label or team label field on Space Admin -> Edit Space Labels screen & click add
2. Warning message stating label is invalid is displayed
3. Invalid label content is now present in both the content label & team label fields
fields.summary: Invalid content label entries are populated in the team label entry field on the Space Admin -> Edit Space Labels screen when validation fails (& vice versa)

fields.description:
As part of the Confluence 2.10 release we have significantly improved the bundled advanced macros. We have unified parameters, added a few new parameters, and sped up some macros by using a better internal search mechanism. 

[All the JIRA issues are tracked over here|http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&&pid=10685&fixfor=12085&fixfor=12030&fixfor=12015&fixfor=12008&fixfor=11895&sorter/field=priority&sorter/order=DESC&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=ASC]

See the release notes for details: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+2.10+Release+Notes
fields.summary: Umbrella Issue for Advanced Macros Improvements

fields.description:
1. attach a file with a ^ in its filename
2. create link to this attachment
3. ^ inserted to denote link is interpreted with the following ^ in the link name as superscript wiki-markup

Example:
filename caret^.jpg when attached and linked is rendered as;

\[^caret^.jpg\]
fields.summary: links that contain ^ (ie attachment filenames) are interpreted as wiki markup and are rendered as superscript rather than links

fields.description: When using the cursor keys inside an RTE table pressing the up or down keys does not move you up or down a row. Instead they behave like the left and right cursor keys.
fields.summary: Cursor key navigation incorrect in tables in rich text editor
leading space in link alias prevents link being rendered
